title.narrative: CAPACITY TO LEGISLATE, PLAN AND BUDGET

description.narrative: Policy makers and government officials in relevant Ministries have increased ability to legislate, plan and budget for child protection., which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Justice For Children, Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid), Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, boys and girls in Thailand are increasingly protected from violence, neglect and exploitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Policy makers and government officials in relevant Ministries have increased ability to legislate, plan and budget for childprotection.

description.narrative: The national Child Protection system was strengthened through technical support for the Thailand Child Protection System Visioning exercise, the development of a National Roadmap on Alternative Care and strengthening of family support services aimed at preventing unnecessary family separation, the evaluation of the country’s National Child Protection Strategy (NCPS), support to government’s efforts to create a safer online environment for children in Thailand, including migrant and stateless children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/02/2022
